channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump's CDC director out, HHS says — lawyers say she's still in
item.description: Centers for Disease Control Director Susan Monarez has abruptly left the post just weeks after being sworn in, the Department of Health and Human Serv...

item.title: European ministers tell Rubio they'll trigger "snapback" sanctions against Iran Thursday
item.description: The foreign ministers of France, Germany, the U.K. and the EU foreign policy chief told Secretary of State Marco Rubio they will trigger the "snapback...

item.title: What we know about the shooting at Annunciation Catholic Church
item.description: A shooter opened fire during morning Mass at a Catholic school in South Minneapolis Wednesday morning, killing two children and injuring 17 other wors...

item.title: Poll: Republicans’ view of key federal agencies has improved in the last year
item.description: Republicans have a higher approval of several federal agencies under Trump than Biden, while Democrats’ approval rate has dropped.

item.title: White House trade adviser says India tariffs can drop if it ‘stops buying Russian oil’
item.description: Peter Navarro accused the country of funding Russia’s war in Ukraine and harming American taxpayers.

item.title: ICE asks for access to Chicago-area Navy base to assist operations
item.description: The request followed Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s declaration that a “strike team” of ICE agents would arrive in Chicago soon.

item.title: D.C. mayor: "Masked ICE agents" and out-of-town National Guard are ineffective
item.description: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser on Wednesday said "masked ICE agents" have "not worked" and called National Guard troops sent from other states inefficient u...

item.title: Multiple FEMA staff put on leave after letter criticizing Trump admin
item.description: Multiple FEMA staff who signed an open letter criticizing the Trump administration's budget cuts to disaster preparedness were placed on leave Tuesday...

item.title: Michael Anton, longtime MAGA intellectual, to exit State Dept.
item.description: A member of President George W. Bush’s National Security Council, Anton later urged reluctant conservatives to back Donald Trump in 2016.

item.title: Trump to hold meeting on Gaza aid efforts amid conflict and famine
item.description: U.S. Special Envoy to the Middle East and Russia Steve Witkoff blamed Hamas for holding up a truce. He projected a deal by the end of the year.

item.title: Former Trump statistics chief slams Friday firing of Erika McEntarfer
item.description: Bill Beach said the president's suggestions that the jobs report was rigged betrayed a misunderstanding in how those numbers are assembled.

item.title: Trump fires statistics chief after soft jobs report
item.description: The monthly jobs report showed just 73,000 jobs in July, with big reductions to May's and June's numbers

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
